title: The Mugwumps...The Mugwumps(1967)[FLAC]
description:
01. Searchin' (2:52)
02. I Don't Wanna Know (2:07)
03. I'll Remember Tonight (2:00)

07. Evreybody's Been Talkin' (2:26)

Each song is quick and energetic, and has a classic 60Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s folk-rock feel. The harmonizing is spot on, particularly in SearchinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ and EverybodyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Been TalkinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ where the backups by Cass really shine through, as do the occasional high notes and almost-yelling vocals being hit on the male end. While no song is over three minutes long, the expressive You CanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t Judge a Book by the Cover clocks in at 2:59 and outshines the other eight songs on the album for sheer quality, of writing, singing, and performing. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the kind of song that would be released as a single on the radio today to promote a new band, the kind of single fans download on iTunes and listen to over and over.

Surprisingly, the 21-minute length of the album doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t disappoint, and in fact turns it into a quick and relaxing easy listen that asks to be left on repeat and let to play over and over. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a great tribute to music from the 60Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s (big surprise since it was recorded in the Ã¢â‚¬â„¢60Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s, right?) and though some of the songs sound vaguely familiar - due to the large amount of music of this type made in the time period - each song manages to hold its own with the listenerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ears and stay new.
